productRequirementsDocument.title: PRD for Fitness application discussion
productRequirementsDocument.executiveSummary: The Fitness application discussion project aims to develop a comprehensive fitness app that leverages AI-driven personalization, wearable device integration, virtual classes, nutrition tracking, social challenges, and mental health features to deliver a holistic user experience. Drawing from industry trends such as AI personalization, wearable compatibility, virtual fitness, and mental health integration, the app will incorporate best practices from competitors like Nike Training Club, MyFitnessPal, Strava, Peloton, and Fitbit. The MVP will focus on high-priority features to achieve business goals including improved user engagement, market share capture, monetization through subscriptions, and regulatory compliance, while adhering to constraints like a 9-month timeline and $5 million budget.

inScope.li: Personalized Workout Recommendation (UC-001): AI-driven customized workout plans based on user data.
Sync with Wearable Devices (UC-002): Seamless integration for automatic data syncing from wearables.
Join Virtual Fitness Class (UC-003): Participation in live or on-demand classes with AR and social features.

outOfScope.li: Advanced nutrition tracking beyond basic calorie counting (UC-004, to be phased in post-MVP).
Social challenges and leaderboards (UC-005, to be phased in post-MVP).
Mental health features like mindfulness tools (UC-006, to be phased in post-MVP).
Hardware development or proprietary wearable devices.
Integration with non-fitness third-party services beyond specified APIs.

businessGoals.goal: Increase user engagement through personalized recommendations and gamification, targeting a 30% retention rate improvement.
Achieve cross-platform compatibility and seamless integrations to capture 20% of the fitness app market share.
Monetize via flexible subscription models, aiming for 50% of users on premium plans within the first year.
Ensure regulatory compliance to build trust and avoid penalties, focusing on GDPR and HIPAA adherence.

useCase.title: Personalized Workout Recommendation
useCase.description: The system uses AI and machine learning to analyze user data and provide customized workout plans based on goals, preferences, and historical performance, aligning with industry trends for AI-driven personalization and competitor insights from Nike Training Club's video library.

mainFlow.step: User accesses the workout recommendation feature from the dashboard.
System analyzes user's historical data, wearable syncs, and preferences using AI/ML algorithms.
System generates a personalized workout plan with step-by-step instructions, including video guides or AR elements.
User reviews and selects the recommended plan.
User starts the workout, with the app tracking progress in real-time.
Upon completion, system updates user data and suggests adjustments for future sessions.

flow.trigger: If no historical data is available
flow.step: System prompts user to input initial assessment data.

useCase.title: Sync with Wearable Devices
useCase.description: The app seamlessly integrates with wearable devices like smartwatches and fitness trackers for automatic data syncing, reflecting trends in wearable compatibility and best practices for cross-platform integration, similar to Fitbit's hardware-software synergy.

mainFlow.step: User initiates sync from the app's settings menu.
App sends request to wearable device API via RESTful APIs.
Wearable device transmits activity data (e.g., steps, heart rate, sleep) securely.
System processes and stores data in cloud-based storage.
App updates user's dashboard with synced metrics and provides insights.
User receives notifications for achievements or anomalies.

flow.step: Data syncs automatically upon reconnection, ensuring offline functionality.
System guides user through troubleshooting steps.

useCase.title: Join Virtual Fitness Class
useCase.description: Users participate in live or on-demand virtual classes, including AR-guided workouts, incorporating trends in hybrid fitness experiences and Peloton's premium class offerings, with social features for community building.

mainFlow.step: User browses and selects a virtual class (live or on-demand) from the app.
For live classes, user joins the stream with real-time interaction.
App provides AR overlays or video playback with instructor guidance.
User follows along, with the app tracking movements and providing feedback.
Upon completion, user can share achievements on social features.
System records progress and updates user stats.

flow.trigger: If connectivity drops during live class

useCase.title: Track Nutrition and Calories
useCase.description: Users log and monitor food intake with accurate calorie counting, leveraging partnerships for database accuracy like MyFitnessPal, and integrating AI for personalized nutrition advice.

mainFlow.step: User opens the nutrition tracking feature.
User inputs food items via search, barcode scan, or voice.
System queries nutrition database for calorie and nutrient data.
App calculates daily totals and compares to goals.
System provides AI-driven recommendations for meal adjustments.
User reviews and edits logs; system updates dashboard.

useCase.title: Participate in Social Challenges
useCase.description: Users join group challenges, share progress, and compete on leaderboards, incorporating social features and gamification trends, inspired by Strava's community-driven elements.

mainFlow.step: User browses available challenges from the social tab.
User joins a challenge (e.g., step count or workout streak).
App tracks user's progress and syncs with group data.
User shares achievements or posts updates.
System updates leaderboards and sends notifications for milestones.
Upon challenge end, user receives rewards like badges.

flow.step: User can create a new challenge.

useCase.title: Access Mental Health Features
useCase.description: Users engage with mindfulness tools and stress reduction exercises, integrating mental health trends with physical fitness, ensuring accessibility and privacy compliance.

mainFlow.step: User selects mental health section from the dashboard.
App offers guided meditations or breathing exercises based on user data.
User participates in a session, with progress tracked.
System provides post-session insights and personalized tips.
User can log mood or stress levels for future recommendations.
Data is stored securely with end-to-end encryption.

nonFunctionalRequirements.requirement: All sensitive health data must be encrypted at rest and in transit using industry-standard protocols, with compliance to GDPR, CCPA, and HIPAA, including end-to-end encryption and regular security audits.
The system must support real-time syncing and responses for 95% of user interactions within 2 seconds, utilizing cloud-based storage for scalability and offline functionality.
